column4: Are there any easy-to-use graphical FTP server softwares to save me all the headache that is vsftpd? =/ You know, like Windows' G6 Bulletproof FTP server
Because I've been ripping my hair out for the last week trying to make vsftpd work properly
So far, I've got it locally accepting anonymous connections
proftpd, eh? You got it going the way you like?
Do you have a firewall running?
not a firewall. I do have a router, but I forwarded all the correct ports
Run an nmap from an external source to verify that the ports are open and working
yes.  Msg me is you need a hand doing a scan from remote.

Either your ISP is blocking traffic our your router is not configured correctly.  I was not able to return any ports being open.  I just scanned from three different major ISP's with the same results.
Scratch that, I just got the port list.
connection is refused but the port is open.
Is vsftp set to listen on your LAN interface?
What do you mean? I can connect to the ftp from within the lan, but from anywhere else, it's 'connection refused'
check the port forwarding on the router.
